Docs.summary: Defines the metadata attribute that Web server controls use to indicate support for event validation. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Event validation prevents forged postbacks to an ASP.NET Web page and can be enabled through the `EnableEventValidation` page directive.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.EnableEventValidation%2A>. For more information about attributes, see [Attributes](~/docs/standard/attributes/index.md).

block.para: If you do not define the attribute, your custom control does not automatically participate in event validation. However, your control can explicitly call . If you handle event registration and validation, call , and then you do not need to define this attribute on the control.
